pages.text: Punnett squares are used to visualize the inheritance of alleles for a particular trait. Each parent is assigned a side of the square, and then for each parent the alleles are separated and assigned a row or column. The square is then filled in with the respective allele from each parent, representing the 4 possible genotypes of the offspring.

pages.title: Punnett Squares
pages.text: An example Punnett square for a parent with XX alleles and a parent with Xx alleles. 50% of the offspring are XX and 50% are Xx.
